availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Milton S. Bourland (Lyon County, Ky, Baptist preacher)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, minister. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah A. Vaughn Bourland. Father of Bayliss E. Bourland, Mary A. J. Bourland, Thomas B. Bourland, Harriett Olive. Bourland, and Marcia Carrie Bourland. United Baptist minister in Lyon County, Kentucky, in 1860. Resident of Madisonville in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, p. 677.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Texas, Shelby County, Precinct 5, p. 198A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994046, Lyon County Births.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994046, Lyon County Deaths.
Texas Death Certificates, 1903-1982, Bureau of Vital Statistics, Department of State Health Services, Austin, TX, File #4011.
